alert.note: Alert for Kuskokwim Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 10 at 5:31AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: Gusty northerly winds will increase in coverage across the Kuskokwim Delta on Sunday with periods of blowing snow and reduced visibility anticipated. The strongest winds, initially along the coast this morning, are expected to expand north and east through tonight. Wind gusts are forecast to range anywhere from 35 mph to as high as 45 mph in some areas. Despite no precipitation, transportable snow, already on the ground, will become lofted quite easily. Thus, periods of blowing snow will lead to subsequent periods of reduced visibility down to a half mile at times. Winds will briefly taper off from east to west by midday on Monday. Much of the transportable snow will have been moved and the threat for more significant blowing snow will come to an end.
